response: The Well-Drilling Rig is part of the OSE Agriculture. EN AR BG BN CS DE EL EO ES FR HE HI HU HR ID IT JA LT NL NO PA PL PT RO RU SV TH TR UK VI ZH-HANS Article Title: Well-Drilling Rig Well-Drilling Rig     Home  |  Research & Development   |   Bill of Materials  |   Manufacturing Instructions  |   User's Manual  |   User Reviews     Main > Water Contents 1 Overview 2 Description 3 Product Ecology 4 Components 5 Status 6 Internal Links 7 External Links Overview Well-Drilling Rig The Well Drilling Rig enables the construction of water wells. Water is crucial for human and animal consumption, washing, irrigation, and industrial processes. Access to clean drinking water is one of the key challenges facing many countries today. Addressing this need with the GVCS has the potential for far reaching impact. prompt: What is the MicroTrac in Open Source Ecology?
response: The MicroTrac is part of the OSE Agriculture. Hint: See Tractor Construction Set 2017 for more design details, and burndown graph. MicroTrac v17.10 Short description Specifications Product Ecology Uses Power Cube License OSHWA and OSI compliant. CC-BY-SA-4.0 International, GPLv3, DIN SPEC 3105 . Tracks 1/2" x2" steel bar welded track Power Cube 16-27 hp as needed Key Specification Open source design for Distributive Enterprise and lifetime design. Construction 1/4"x4" perforated steel tubine, 3" shafts for wheels and loader arm Productivity Full capacity for quick tool attachment with hydraulic takeoff to implements on the loader allow for mulfunction flexibility. Completion Status Prototype 2. Near product release pending Universal Track Unit completion. See more at Lifetrac Genealogy and Status of Completion . Do you want more of this? prompt: What is the 3D Printer in Open Source Ecology?
response: The 3D Printer is part of the OSE Industry. EN AR BG BN CS DE EL EO ES FR HE HI HU HR ID IT JA LT NL NO PA PL PT RO RU SV TH TR UK VI ZH-HANS Article Title: 3D Printer 3D Printer Research and Development The OSE printer is called D3D - for Distributive Enterprise 3D Printer. For Current Work see 3D Printer Genealogy . Contents 1 Overview 2 Genealogy 2.1 Details 2.1.1 Types of 3D Printers 2.1.2 Printing Process 2.1.3 Applications 2.2 Product Ecology 2.3 Status 2.4 See Also 2.5 Further reading Overview 3D Printers are a subset of CNC machines: they use stepper motors to move along X, Y, and Z axes according to gCode - essentially a text file with thousands of lines of coordinates and special commands (such as "return to origin" or "set nozzle temperature"). As motors on each axis moves the nozzle through 3D space, an additional motor feeds plastic filament through a heating element, very much like an automatic hot glue gun. The software that turns a 3D model (such as an .stl or .obj) into instructions telling the printer how to mo

EN AR BG BN CS DE EL EO ES FR HE HI HU HR ID IT JA LT NL NO PA PL PT RO RU SV TH TR UK VI ZH-HANS Article Title: Induction Furnace Induction Furnace     Home  |  Research & Development   |   Bill of Materials  |   Manufacturing Instructions  |   User's Manual  |   User Reviews     Main > Digital Fabrication > RepLab Tools > Induction furnace Contents 1 Overview 2 Requirements 3 Details 4 Development Notes 5 Product Ecology 6 Components 7 Status 8 Internal Links 9 External Links Overview An induction furnace is composed of an induction coil, alternating current power supply, and electrically conductive workpiece. The 'primary' coil induces current in the 'secondary' workpiece through electromagnetism. This current is converted to heat at a rate of VI=I 2 R . Contents 1 Overview 1.1 Details 1.2 Product Ecology 1.3 Status 1.4 See Also 2 Links Overview Steam Generator The Steam Generator is a device used to create steam by applying thermal energy to water. Details It can be used to power devices such as steam engines and steam turbines . Both of these machines convert expanding steam into rotational power, power that can be used to drive other GVCS tools or generate electric power. Excess or vented steam can also be used to heat a home or greenhouse. Steam Generator Pages Steam Engine Design/Boiler Flash Steam Generator CHP Stove Heat Exchanger S

EN AR BG BN CS DE EL EO ES FR HE HI HU HR ID IT JA LT NL NO PA PL PT RO RU SV TH TR UK VI ZH-HANS Article Title: Aluminum Extractor Aluminum Extractor     Home  |  Research & Development   |   Bill of Materials  |   Manufacturing Instructions  |   User's Manual  |   User Reviews     Main > Materials Aluminum Extractor Contents 1 Overview 2 Detail 3 Product Ecology 4 Components 5 See Also Overview The Aluminum Extractor extracts raw aluminum from alumina common clay (alumina silicate). Detail Using a closed-loop cycle involving hydroflouric acid and a large amount of electricity, it is possible to extract raw aluminum directly from clay deposits. This is in contrast to the typical aluminum extraction technique from strategic bauxite mineral reserves. prompt: What is the Open Source Hardware in Open Source Ecology?
response: The Open Source Hardware is part of the OSE Core Concepts. Hardware that is designed openly and collaboratively with zero barriers to entry for participants, and that follows the Open Source Hardware Definition . Articles 2019 - Adapting OS Methods to Products - [1] 2018 Video by Cos(h) from Hamburg Check out this short video explaining open source - from our collaborators in Hamburg, who are working on an open source solar charger and power system. Video does not mention economic freedom - meaning that you can sell open source products. This is a point that most people do not understand, so it should be emphasized for adoption. b https://vimeo.com/280147726 What is Open Source Hardware? from flojoART on Vimeo .

prompt: What is the Distributive Enterprise in Open Source Ecology?
response: The Distributive Enterprise is part of the OSE Core Concepts. Hint: A Distributive Enterprise (DE) is an enterprise that is created free of IP and with openness by the author to share and distribute, such that it can help the world improve - as further collaborative development can result from the sharing. A distributive enterprise is one that focuses on open economic development - open collaboration in innovation. This means that all of its product design and business operations are open source and intended for replication according to an open hardware, OSHWA-approved license - except with the extra requirement of in-process documentation (as opposed to just publishing final results). Short link to this page: http://bit.ly/1rxK4Gf Contents 1 Summary 2 Publication 3 Affordances 4 Overview 5 To Collaborate on Distributive Enterprise with OSE 6 Open Branding 7 Free Branding 8 Details 9 Main Points 10 Proposed Business Model 11 Case Studies 12 Distributive Enterprise Survey 13 Discussion 14 Open Source Ecology Case 15 History 16 OSE Success Metrics

prompt: What is the Open Building Institute in Open Source Ecology?
response: The Open Building Institute is part of the OSE Core Concepts. An open source effort to make affordable ecological housing widely accessible. https://www.openbuildinginstitute.org/ Have always been a big fan of @OSEcology Thrilled to see their new kickstarter for building your own house. https://t.co/lCND44Lf4y — Dave Hakkens (@davehakkens) June 30, 2016
